Class FSM_API.Error

Provides a centralized system for managing and reporting errors and warnings within the FSM API. This class allows you to configure error thresholds for automatic cleanup of misbehaving FSMs and subscribe to internal diagnostic notifications.

Inheritance
object

Namespace: TheSingularityWorkshop.FSM_API
Assembly: FSM_API.dll
Syntax
public static class FSM_API.Error
Remarks

The API uses a robust error handling mechanism to ensure system stability. When FSM instances or definitions encounter repeated errors (e.g., exceptions during state entry/exit, or transition evaluation), this system tracks those occurrences. If predefined thresholds are met, the problematic FSM instance or even the entire FSM definition can be automatically removed to prevent ongoing issues or resource consumption.

You can also subscribe to the OnInternalApiError event to receive real-time notifications about non-FSM-specific internal errors, warnings, or significant API events.

Properties

| Edit this page View Source

DefinitionErrorThreshold

The maximum number of times an FSM definition can cause an instance to be shut down due to errors before the entire definition is scheduled for destruction.

Declaration
public static int DefinitionErrorThreshold { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
int
Remarks

If multiple instances of the same FSM definition repeatedly fail (reaching their InstanceErrorThreshold), it might indicate a fundamental flaw in the FSM's design. When this threshold is met, the problematic FSM definition will be removed from the system, and all its remaining active instances will be shut down.

| Edit this page View Source

InstanceErrorThreshold

The maximum number of consecutive errors an FSM instance can encounter before it is automatically shut down.

Declaration
public static int InstanceErrorThreshold { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
int
Remarks

Once an FSM instance reaches this error count, it will be automatically unregistered from the system to prevent it from causing further issues.

Methods

| Edit this page View Source

GetDefinitionErrorCounts()

Provides a read-only dictionary of current definition-specific error counts. Each entry maps an FSM definition name (string) to the number of errors encountered related to that definition.

Declaration
public static Dictionary<string, int> GetDefinitionErrorCounts()
Returns
Type Description
Dictionary<string, int>

A Dictionary<TKey, TValue> where keys are FSM definition names (strings) and values are their respective error counts.
Remarks

This method is primarily intended for internal monitoring and testing purposes. Definition error counts are incremented via InvokeDefinitionError(string, string). When a definition's error count reaches the DefinitionErrorThreshold, the FSM definition and all its active instances are scheduled for complete destruction, and its entry is removed from this dictionary.

| Edit this page View Source

GetErrorCounts()

Provides a read-only dictionary of current instance-specific error counts for active FSM handles. Each entry maps an FSMHandle to the number of errors encountered by that instance.

Declaration
public static Dictionary<FSMHandle, int> GetErrorCounts()
Returns
Type Description
Dictionary<FSMHandle, int>

A Dictionary<TKey, TValue> where keys are FSMHandle instances and values are their respective error counts.
Remarks

This method is primarily intended for internal monitoring and testing purposes. Error counts are incremented via InvokeInstanceError(FSMHandle, string, Exception, string). When an FSM instance's error count reaches the InstanceErrorThreshold, the instance is scheduled for destruction, and its entry is removed from this dictionary.

| Edit this page View Source

InvokeDefinitionError(string, string)

Invokes an error specifically related to an FSM definition, typically when an instance derived from it has been shut down due to repeated errors.

Declaration
public static void InvokeDefinitionError(string fsmDefinitionName, string processingGroup)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string fsmDefinitionName

The name of the FSM definition that caused the error.
string processingGroup

The processing group of the FSM definition.
Remarks

This method tracks definition-specific errors and will automatically schedule the complete destruction of the FSM definition and all its instances if its error count reaches the DefinitionErrorThreshold.

Exceptions
Type Condition
ArgumentException

Thrown if fsmDefinitionName or processingGroup is null, empty, or whitespace.
| Edit this page View Source

InvokeInstanceError(FSMHandle, string, Exception, string)

Invokes an error specifically related to a misbehaving FSM instance.

Declaration
public static void InvokeInstanceError(FSMHandle handle, string message, Exception exception, string processGroup = "Update")
Parameters
Type Name Description
FSMHandle handle

The FSMHandle instance that encountered the error.
string message

A descriptive message about the instance error.
Exception exception

The associated exception, or null if no exception occurred.
string processGroup

The name of the processing group where the error occurred (default is "Update").
Remarks

This method tracks instance-specific errors and will automatically shut down the handle if its error count reaches the InstanceErrorThreshold.

Exceptions
Type Condition
ArgumentNullException

Thrown if handle is null.
| Edit this page View Source

InvokeInternalApiError(string, Exception)

Invokes the OnInternalApiError event. This method is used internally by the FSM API to report critical non-instance-specific issues.

Declaration
public static void InvokeInternalApiError(string message, Exception exception)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string message

A descriptive message about the error or event.
Exception exception

The associated exception, or null if no exception occurred.
| Edit this page View Source

Reset()

Resets all internal error tracking counters for both FSM instances and FSM definitions.

Declaration
public static void Reset()
Remarks

This method clears all accumulated instance-specific and definition-specific error counts. It is typically used for internal cleanup or to provide a fresh state, for example, at the start of new test runs or when explicitly resetting the FSM API's error tracking.

| Edit this page View Source

ResetDefinitionErrorCount(string)

Resets the accumulated error count for a specific FSM definition. This is typically called when an FSM definition is explicitly destroyed or reloaded, to clear its error history.

Declaration
public static void ResetDefinitionErrorCount(string fsmDefinitionName)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string fsmDefinitionName

The name of the FSM definition whose error count to reset.
| Edit this page View Source

Resets the accumulated error count for a specific FSMHandle

OnInternalApiError

Occurs when a non-FSM-instance-specific internal error, warning, or significant API event is reported. Subscribe to this event to receive diagnostic notifications about the FSM API's internal operations.
